content.title: Mukhyamantri Konya Atmonirbhor Yojana
content.department: Directorate of Higher Education, Government of Tripura
content.beneficiary: Meritorious girls studying in General Degree Colleges
content.details: The scheme 'Mukhyamantri Konya Atmonirbhor Yojana' was launched by the Directorate of Higher Education, Government of Tripura. The meritorious girls studying in the 1st semester of a course in the General Degree Colleges in Tripura are provided with a free Scooty for travelling to their College. The aspiring student should apply as per the prescribed format to the Higher Education Department of Tripura through the College she is enrolled in.
benefits: A free Scooty for the purpose of travelling to their College.
eligibility: The applicant should be a resident of Tripura.
The applicant should be a girl.
The applicant should be a student.
The parents/guardians of the applicant should be a native of Tripura or have a continuous residence in Tripura for not less than ten years.
The applicant should be studying in the 1st semester of a course at the General Degree College in Tripura.
content.application_process: Offline. The interested applicant should request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the college staff or take print of the prescribed format of the application form. Fill in all mandatory fields, attach required documents, and submit to the Principal of the college.
documents_required: Income Certificate (Issued by Sub-Divisional Magistrate (SDM)/ Deputy Commissioner of Magistrate (DCM)/ Competent Authority)
Front page bank passbook of the applicant

faqs.question: Can applicants residing outside Tripura apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, applicants must be residents of Tripura to be eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the role of the Principal/Principal-In-Charge in the application process?
faqs.answer: The Principal/Principal-In-Charge of the college is responsible for receiving and processing the application forms submitted by the students.

faqs.question: Can applicants download the application form online?
faqs.answer: Yes, interested applicants can take a print of the prescribed format of the application form.

faqs.question: Are there any specific documents required for the application?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants need to provide documents such as Aadhaar Card, 12th grade Marksheet, Birth certificate/Madhyamik Admit Card, Permanent Resident Tripura Certificate (PRTC), Income Certificate, Guardian's Address Proof, Bank Passbook, Disability Certificate (if applicable), and any other document as required.

faqs.question: What benefit does the scheme provide to meritorious girls studying in General Degree Colleges in Tripura?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides a free Scooty for traveling to their college.

faqs.question: Can applicants submit their application forms electronically?
faqs.answer: No, the application process is offline, and applicants need to submit hard copies of the application form to their college authorities.

faqs.question: Who is responsible for issuing the Income Certificate required for the application?
faqs.answer: The Income Certificate is issued by the Sub-Divisional Magistrate (SDM)/Deputy Commissioner of Magistrate (DCM) or a competent authority.

faqs.question: How does the scheme ensure transparency and accountability in the application process?
faqs.answer: By requiring applicants to obtain a receipt or acknowledgment upon submission, the scheme establishes a transparent record of application submissions.

faqs.question: What role does the Permanent Resident Tripura Certificate (PRTC) play in the eligibility criteria?
faqs.answer: The PRTC serves as proof of the applicant's residency status in Tripura, a requirement for eligibility.

faqs.question: Is there any restriction on the type of course or program the applicant must be enrolled in to qualify for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme does not specify any restrictions on the type of course or program. As long as the applicant is enrolled in the 1st semester of a course at a General Degree College in Tripura, they are eligible.

faqs.question: Can students enrolled in professional courses or vocational programs avail themselves of the scheme benefits?
faqs.answer: The scheme does not explicitly exclude students from professional courses or vocational programs, provided they meet all other eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: Are there any income criteria for eligibility under the scheme?
faqs.answer: There are no income-related eligibility criteria for this scheme.
